title: sans serif, decorative/display?
author: kayray

comments.content: please help me ID this typeface, THANKS!

There are 2 fonts matching your sample (if you make them a bit bolder):  
 **[Stringline](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317174255/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Nick-Curtis&ffam=Stringline%20-%20Regular&fid=bc3bc144721e9dd1c03eaa368b7e5835&fstyle=b&fsize=60&text=Northwest%20Ohio%20Association%20of%20School%20Nurses&wrap=2)** - Copyright (c) Nick Curtis, sign DNA 1970  
 **[Perisphere](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317174255/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Nick-Curtis&ffam=Perisphere%20-%20Regular&fid=319f571ac56f887914ff862d08442547&fstyle=b&fsize=60&text=Northwest%20Ohio%20Association%20of%20School%20Nurses&wrap=2)** also by Nick-Curtis (2000)  
but I can't find a legitimate source to acquire them.
Perisphere (Regular) looks spot on, thanks. I'll see if I can find it out there. I tried for hours to find, should have come here first!! Really appreciate the effort
See the message of Oldnick above; he is the designer of the fonts and he gave you the correct link to **Stringline** font ;)
